### Entry Level

#### P1035 summation of series

>**DESCRIPTION**
>
>Known: $S_n= 1+1/2+1/3+â€¦+1/n$. 
>
>It's obvious that for any integer $k$ when integer $n$ is big enough, $S_n>k$.
>
>Now give an integer $k$. Please find the smallest $n$ which makes $S_n>k$.
>
>**INPUT FORMAT**
>
>A positive integer $k$.
>
>**OUTPUT FORMAT**
>
>A positive integer $n$.
>
>**SAMPLE**
>
>Input
>
>1
>
>Output
>
>2
>
>**TIPS**
>
>For 100% data, $1\le k \le 15$

It should be noted that: integer data cannot appear in floating-point operations, otherwise it becomes an integer operation.

```c++
#include<iostream>
using namespace std;

int main()
{
	int n=0;
	int k=0;
	double sn=0.0000;//Pay attention to data accuracy
	double temp=0.0000;//Pay attention to data accuracy 
	
	cin>>k;
	while(sn<=k)
	{
		n++;
		temp=1.0000/n;//do not use int data 
		sn=sn+temp;
	}
	
	cout<<n;
	
	return 0;	
}
```
